idiom: ដាក់ជើងលើក្បាល
literal_meaning: To put a foot on the head.
example: He always tries to put his foot on my head in meetings.

idiom: ស្លាបព្រិលលើទឹក
figurative_meaning: Something that is fleeting or temporary.
example: Her promises were like snowflakes on water; they didn't last long.

idiom: ចេះតែបង្ហាញខ្លួន
figurative_meaning: To be boastful or show off.
example: He is always showing himself off at parties.

idiom: ចេញពីក្បាល
literal_meaning: To come out of the head.
figurative_meaning: To think outside the box or be creative.
example: She really came out of her head with that innovative idea.

idiom: មិនមានអ្វីដូចគ្នា
figurative_meaning: To emphasize differences between things or people.
example: When comparing the two projects, there is nothing alike between them.

idiom: ធ្វើដូចជាមិនដឹង
example: He did it again and just did ដូចជាមិនដឹង.

figurative_meaning: To be patient or take things slowly.
example: You need to take time when making important decisions.

idiom: ស្តាប់តាមស្មារតី
figurative_meaning: To listen with understanding and empathy.
example: It’s important to listen according to spirit when others share their feelings.

idiom: មិនចេះឈប់ឈរ
literal_meaning: To not know how to stop.
example: He is a hard worker who doesn’t know how to stop.

idiom: ត្រូវការបង្ហាញខ្លួន
example: She always needs to show herself at every event.
